page.title: 08People and Places
page.content: There are many interesting places to explore in the Norbury and Roston area. One such place is the small cottage on Roston Commom the home of the famous novelist George Eliots grandparents. The parish church is another place well worth a visit. Norbury Mill mentioned in the original Domsday Book is again very interesting but not open to the public without prior permission from the owners. These two very significant buildings are not looked at in more detail because they are located just out of our grid reference. The Lecture House on Green Lane is quite unusual, private dwelling downstairs, place of worship upstairs.Services held regularly, see notice board outside.
